verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329><s%> Musician, <S%H5329><s%> A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> and Song <S%H7892><s%> of David. <S%H1732><s%> Praise <S%H8416><s%> waits <S%H1747><s%> for you, O God, <S%H430><s%> in Sion: <S%H6726><s%> and to you shall the vow <S%H5088><s%> be performed. <S%H7999><s%>
O you that hear <S%H8085><s%> prayer, <S%H8605><s%> to you shall all <S%H3605><s%> flesh <S%H1320><s%> come. <S%H935><s%>
Iniquities <S%H1697><s%> <S%H5771><s%> prevail <S%H1396><s%> against me: as for our transgressions, <S%H6588><s%> you shall purge <S%H3722><s%> them away.

Blessed <S%H835><s%> is the man whom you choose, <S%H977><s%> and cause to approach <S%H7126><s%> to you, that he may dwell <S%H7931><s%> in your courts: <S%H2691><s%> we shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%> with the goodness <S%H2898><s%> of your house, <S%H1004><s%> even of your holy <S%H6918><s%> temple. <S%H1964><s%>

By terrible <S%H3372><s%> things in righteousness <S%H6664><s%> will you answer <S%H6030><s%> us, O God <S%H430><s%> of our salvation; <S%H3468><s%> who are the confidence <S%H4009><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the ends <S%H7099><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> and of them that are afar <S%H7350><s%> off on the sea: <S%H3220><s%>
Which by his strength <S%H3581><s%> sets <S%H3559><s%> fast the mountains; <S%H2022><s%> being girded <S%H247><s%> with power: <S%H1369><s%>
Which stills <S%H7623><s%> the noise <S%H7588><s%> of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> the noise <S%H7588><s%> of their waves, <S%H1530><s%> and the tumult <S%H1995><s%> of the people. <S%H3816><s%>

They also that dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the uttermost <S%H7098><s%> parts are afraid <S%H3372><s%> at your tokens: <S%H226><s%> you make the outgoings <S%H4161><s%> of the morning <S%H1242><s%> and evening <S%H6153><s%> to rejoice. <S%H7442><s%>

You visit <S%H6485><s%> the earth, <S%H776><s%> and water <S%H7783><s%> it: you greatly <S%H7227><s%> enrich <S%H6238><s%> it with the river <S%H6388><s%> of God, <S%H430><s%> which is full <S%H4390><s%> of water: <S%H4325><s%> you prepare <S%H3559><s%> them corn, <S%H1715><s%> when you have so <S%H3651><s%> provided <S%H3559><s%> for it.

You water <S%H7301><s%> the ridges <S%H8525><s%> thereof abundantly: <S%H7301><s%> you settle <S%H5181><s%> the furrows <S%H1417><s%> thereof: you make it soft <S%H4127><s%> with showers: <S%H7241><s%> you bless <S%H1288><s%> the springing <S%H6780><s%> thereof.
You crown <S%H5849><s%> the year <S%H8141><s%> with your goodness; <S%H2896><s%> and your paths <S%H4570><s%> drop <S%H7491><s%> fatness. <S%H1880><s%>
They drop <S%H7491><s%> on the pastures <S%H4999><s%> of the wilderness: <S%H4057><s%> and the little hills <S%H1389><s%> rejoice <S%H1524><s%> on every side. <S%H2296><s%>

The pastures <S%H3733><s%> are clothed <S%H3847><s%> with flocks; <S%H6629><s%> the valleys <S%H6010><s%> also are covered <S%H5848><s%> over <S%H5848><s%> with corn; <S%H1250><s%> they shout <S%H7321><s%> for joy, they also <S%H637><s%> sing. <S%H7891><s%>
